entries.text: Thank you for calling VeloFit Customer Support. My name is Amy, how may I assist you today?
Yeah, hi. I want to return something I bought. I'm not happy with it.
Okay, I can help with that. Can you please provide me with your order number or the email address associated with your VeloFit account?
It's order number 789456123. I want to return this VeloBand Pulse. It's just not working out for me.
Thank you. One moment while I pull up your order. Okay, I see you purchased the VeloBand Pulse on October 26th, and today is November 10th. According to our records, that's 15 days ago.
Yeah, so? I want to return it. It's not my problem if it took you ages to deliver it!
I understand your frustration. However, our standard return window for the VeloBand Pulse, as stated in our return policy, is 10 days from the date of purchase.
Ten days? Seriously? That's ridiculous! I want my money back. I can't believe this. This is terrible customer service!

I apologize that the return window is causing you inconvenience. Unfortunately, because it's past the 10-day return window, I cannot process a full refund to your original payment method. However, while a full refund is not possible, let me see if a policy exception can be made.

Okay, I've checked with my supervisor. While a full refund is not possible due to the elapsed time, I can offer you store credit for the full purchase price of the VeloBand Pulse. This store credit will never expire and can be used on any product on our website.
Store credit? So I can't get my money back? This is still annoying. But I guess it's better than nothing. Okay, fine. Store credit is acceptable then.

Great. I have processed the store credit for the amount of $[purchase amount]. You should receive an email confirmation within the next few minutes with the code. Is there anything else I can help you with today?
No, I think that's all. Thanks for at least doing something. I appreciate it.
You're very welcome! We appreciate your business with VeloFit. Have a great day!
